title: Learner-Centered Mobile Mathematics Integration Course for Healthcare Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and professional work experience
context.additional_context: Modular design optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, aiming to enhance mathematical thinking essential for medical practice.

learning_goals: Learners can independently approach medical data analysis problems with over 80% proficiency by applying the five stages of the PLHET model (Preparation-Connection-Interest Induction-Engagement-Transfer).

Utilizing Kolbâ€™s Learning Cycle (Experience-Reflection-Conceptualization-Experimentation), learners can propose at least three problem-solving strategies tailored to their learning style (Assimilating/Diverging/Converging/Accommodating) in medical statistics scenarios.

By engaging with micro-content (5-minute videos/quizzes) delivered in a mobile environment, learners can sustain self-directed study for 10 hours weekly and achieve over 75 points in formative assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
